RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PENALTY TO RANGERS broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late while finishing two wide in the drive. TEXAS LEGACY away alertly and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide midway down the backstretch, was unable to match strides with the leader entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to prove second best. LENT ME TWENTY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. SWEET AS HONEY settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, but needed more of a closing response when called upon. STOLO SPIRIT unhurried early while dropping back to trail, was always well back and failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Lent Me Twenty
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Stolo Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet as Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Penalty to Rangers
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 9 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BABY GRAND away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. WISE MARKET away well and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run to the final turn, chased the leader two wide into the final turn, was unable to match strides with that rival through the turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. FOOT SOLDIER broke sharply and stalked the early pace from along the rail entering the backstretch, pulled himself into a tracking trip in the run to the final turn, saved ground through the turn, and finished two wide in the drive to garner a share. DRILLER stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a late bid while finishing three wide in the drive. JUVEE TOO ducked in soon after the start and unseated his rider. JUVEE TOO walked off the track under his own power following the race.

ENTRY.NAME: Foot Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Juvee Too
ENTRY.OWNER: High Stakes Thoroughbreds and Snow John
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in, lost rider

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, held

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Ra ce Since April 25 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GORKY PARK tracked the leaders from along the rail entering the stretch the first time while under snug restraint, continued to race up on heels at the rail entering the second turn before finally settling off the leaders entering the backstretch, saved ground at the rail through the final turn, shifted three wide for the drive and ran down YOU DON'T OWN ME late to prove best. YOU DON'T OWN ME away well and pressed the pace from the outside of CALAMAZEUS through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue in the run down the backside, held a narrow advantage into the final turn, increased his lead through the turn, but was unable to fend off GORKY PARK late while proving clearly second best. CALAMAZEUS away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, struggled to match strides with his pace rival entering the final turn, and was outfinished late. PADDY D'ORO broke sharply and tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing three wide, continued with a three wide trip in the run down the backside and into the final turn, and finiished one out from the rail in the drive while unable to mount a late bid. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two wide from between rivals, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide, best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: High Five Racing Stables II, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Calamazeus
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARIKARA away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of ANOTHERSUNNYDAY in the run down the backstretch, shook clear of her pace rival and quickly opened a clear lead through the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. RACINO settled well off the early contested pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid from along the rail approaching the final turn, and finished with interest from just off the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. ANAAMY broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the dueling leaders while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. ANOTHERSUNNYDAY dueled for the lead two wide entering the first turn, forced the issue from the outside of ARIKARA in the run down the backside, was unable to match strides with that rival entering the final turn, and faded over the final furlong. TIMELESS SHRUG unhurried early while trailing well behind the field entering the backstretch, bided her time at the back of the pack in the run to the final turn, saved ground through the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive while unable to make a serious late impact. KANDY KATIE away well and settled off the early pace while racing three wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, was carried wide turning for home, but had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Arikara
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, led, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Timeless Shrug
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Anaamy
ENTRY.OWNER: Goss Maureen Canmor Farms and Trombley Adrian
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Racino
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed inside, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Kandy Katie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Anothersunnyday
ENTRY.OWNER: Leffler Bob Killins Bryan and McCormick Gord
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE BC BRED RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 25 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SLOOP JOHN B broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and held a clear advantage into the final turn, and finished determinedly one out from the rail in the drive while fending off a late surge by ERLICH to prevail. ERLICH tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, dropped in behind the pacesetters entering the second turn while racing two wide, tipped three wide approaching the final turn to launch his bid , and closed steadily three out from the rail in the drive to just miss. ONE FIFTY ONE away alertly and tracked the leader while racing two wide entering the lane the first time, forced the issue from the outside of SLOOP JOHN B in the run to the final turn, dropped back into a tracking trip behind the pacesetter approaching the turn, rallied two wide through the turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. EYE BE SEEING YOU trailed the field into the stretch the first time, continued to bide his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backside while racing two out from the rail, rallied four wide through the turn, and improved his position late while finishing three wide in the drive. TRAPALIS stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing three out from the rail, continued with a wide trip in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. DEBATABLE away well and tracked the leader into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, and had no late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Eye Be Seeing You
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Debatable
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Trapalis
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: One Fifty One
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Sloop John B
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, held

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: David Milburn & Minnaloushe Stables & Don Muldoon

ENTRY.NAME: Erlich
ENTRY.OWNER: Christoff, Gordon and Giesbrecht, Lance B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 89. Claiming Purse 15000. (PLUS UP TO $7,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 25 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,00 0, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST JIMMY away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of STAY FANTASTIC entering the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backside and through the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the lane, and inched clear late to prove best. STAY FANTASTIC broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of JUST JIMMY in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, struggled to keep tabs on his pace rival entering the lane, and gave way grudgingly late while proving clearly second best. FORT LANGLEY unhurried early while dropping back to trail, commenced his bid five wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly four out from the rail in the drive to get up for a share. FAMILY BIZ stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and improved his position in the lane while unable to threaten. MY COLLEGE FUND tracked the leader three wide through the stretch the first time, advanced three wide entering the backstretch to force the issue in the run to the final turn, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but tired over the final furlong. SHOTGUN RIDER away well and tracked the leaders through the lane the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, but weakened in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Shotgun Rider
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Stay Fantastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: My College Fund
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w, advanced 1/2, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Just Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, led, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Langley
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 5 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Family Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 25 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since April 25 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs.3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). BC Bred Claiming Price $5,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis and Perry Tabitha

RACE.FOOTNOTES: THERE GOES MY HERO stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide from between rivals entering the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the stretch, quickly opened a clear advantage, and held SILARONE safely at bay late to prove best. SILARONE stalked the early pace into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, shifted five wide leaving the turn, and closed with a rush while drifting in late and taking the path of ATOMIC HAZE nearing the wire. ATOMIC HAZE stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly four wide through the final turn, and closed willingly three out from the rail in the drive, and was forced to steady late. CHAMPIOSA tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, commenced his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished with late interest three wide in the drive. SETTEBELLO broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of REMEMBERTHEALAMO entering the first turn, forced the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, and finished one out from the rail in the drive. REMEMBERTHEALAMO away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, and faded in the stretch drive. TUXEDO away well and tracked the leaders two wide entering the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. EH TEE EM unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Champiosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Eh Tee Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberthealamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Silarone
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Settebello
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Tuxedo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Atomic Haze
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide, steadied late

ENTRY.NAME: There Goes My Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Klimes Helen McDonald Jo-Anne and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, led, held
